page.title: 02SHEFFIELD'S TOWN HALL
page.content: The{Town Hall}was built in Victorian times and was opened by{Queen {Victoria.}It is ornately decorated. It has a tower with a statue of{Vulcan, the god of fire and forging, on top. He represents the steel industry.There is a modern extension adjoining it which was opened in 1977. There is a large entrance hall and a Grand Staircase of Italian marble. There are two large reception rooms for visitors.The{Lord Mayor}also has a private room known as the Parlour. The visitors' book has been signed by all sorts of important people. There is a large council chamber with oak panelling and much intricate carving. Much of the Sheffield Council's work is carried out in the new extension which contains the Design & Planning, Treasury and Housing Departments.
